cleaned_text: Friday, August 19, 2022Welcome to California COVID -19 Vaccination Program Friday Provider Webinar 1Provider Webinar Q&A 2 During today's session, please use the Q&A panel to ask your questions so CDPH subject matter experts can respond directly . Resource links will be dropped into, "Chat"Housekeeping Reminder to Panelists: Please mute yourself when not speaking. Please monitor the Q&A panel for questions you may be able to answer. Reminder to Attendees : Today's session is being recorded. Access today's slides and archived presentations at: https://eziz.org/covid/education/ If you have post -webinar questions, please email leslie.amani@cdph.ca.gov 3 4Agenda: Friday, August 19, 2022 No. Item Speaker Time (AM) 1 Welcome & Announcements Leslie Amani (Moderator) 9:00 -9:05 2 KidsVaxGrant 2.0 Nisha Handling Kate McHugh (CDPH) 9:25 -9:30 6 Vaccine Management Eric Norton (My Turn) and Daniel Conway (myCAvax) 9:30 -9:40 7 Quality Assurance Compliance Eugene Beronilla and Francisco Borboa (CDPH) 9:40 -9:45 8 Wrap Up & Resources (Moderator) 9:45 -10:00 Q&AAnnouncements Leslie Amani, CDPH 5Therapeutics Email Address 6 CDPH has a new email address for provider and LHJs direct the CDPH COVID -19 Quality Assurance team for a series of three "Quickinars " to review COVID -19 vaccine compliance guidance. Time for all webinars: 12:30PM -1:00PM Wednesday, August 24, 2022: Vaccine Management register here Thursday, August 25, 2022: Clinical register here All sessions will be recorded and posted on EZIZ for on -demand viewing. Archived : Storage and Handling Quickinar slides and recording available here . Upcoming Webinars on Talking with Parents about Back -to-School COVID -19 Vaccines 8 Please join Dr. Emma Olivera, pediatrician and leader in the#VacunateYa campaign, to discuss talking to parents about back -to-school COVID -19 vaccines. This webinar is offered in Spanish and English: TODAY! Webinar in | Back -to-School COVID -19 Vaccines When: Friday, August 26 at 12:00PM -1:00PM Register COVID -19 Crucial ConversationsCongratulations to Dr. Alex McDonald! 2022 CDC Immunization Champion Award Recipient 9 Alex McDonald, MD, FAAFP, CAQSM from Kaiser Permanente and the California Academy of Family Physicians ' Board of Directors has been named the Association of Immunization Managers (AIM) Immunization Champion for California. This annual award, given by the Association of Immunization Managers (AIM), honors exemplary immunization advocates across the country. Dr. McDonald has helped to train hundreds of healthcare heroes on how to effectively talk with diverse audiences about COVID -19 vaccines through his partnership with CDPH on the COVID -19 Crucial Conversations Campaign . Watch Dr. Tomás Aragón and Dr. Alex McDonald in the "How to Have Crucial Conversations about COVID -19 Vaccines" webinar here. NOTE: All times listed here are PDT.Audience: Providers and immunization staff Session Topics Include: New vaccine presentation (Maroon Cap )for individuals 6 months through 4 years of age FDA approvals, authorizations -including recent authorizations Gray Cap, Comirnaty® Use of each vaccine presentation, including storage, handling, preparation, and administration Pfizer COVID -19 Medical Updates and TrainingsModerna Infant/Toddler Vaccine Video Trainings 13 How to Withdraw a 0.25mL dose: Infant/Toddler 6 months -5 years How to Withdraw a 0.5mL Dose for Pediatrics 6 Years -11YearsCOVID -19 Webinars and 8/26 , My Turn, and Combined Office Hours and EventsVaccine Order Request with Q&A 10:00 am -10:30 am My Turn and myCAvax Office Hours 12:00 pm -1:00 pm Pfizer BioNTech COVID -19 Vaccine Training & pm -1:00 PW: Uppv6Vw9yg9Pfizer BioNTech COVID am PW: gxJvGHBP338 Quality Assurance -1:00 pmPfizer COVID -19 am PW: eNEfJNgE272 Quality of 3: 12:30 pm -1:00 pmProvider Office Hours 9:00 am -10:00 am Talking with Parents about Back -to-School COVID -19 Vaccines 12:00 pm -1:00 pm * Pfizer topics vary by day and include the latest information about use of each vaccine presentation, including storage, han dling, preparation, and administration; recent medical updates and FDA authorizations, healthcare provider resources, and a Q&A session. Week of August 22, 2022 Note: Calendar subject to change View On DemandIntro to My Turn Onboarding (v. 1/4/22) Latest Features in My Turn (*Requires My Turn Login)Latest Features in myCAvax for Providers Account Enrollment: Section A: Organization Application (v. 10/21/21) Provider 101 Account Enrollment: Section B: Location Application (v. 10/21/21) Provider Office Hours and MCE Office Hours Archived Sessions 14 KidsVaxGrant 2.0 Nisha Gandhi, CDPH 1516 The California Department of Public Health has appropriated approximately $10 million to support KidsVaxGrant 2.0 Up to $35,000 to support eligible pediatric providers administering the COVID -19 vaccineKidsVaxGrant 2.0 -August 1 -October 14, 2022 Physicians for a Healthy California KidsVaxGrant 2.017KidsVaxGrant 2.0 Funding Opportunities Providers serving pediatric populations that are newly enrolled in the California COVID -19 vaccine program ( myCAvax ) could receive $10,000 per site to support enrollment and launching a vaccination center. Those that enroll in myCAvax from December 17, 2021, through October 14, 2022, will qualify for the grant. Providers serving pediatric populations that are already enrolled in the California COVID -19 vaccine program ( myCAvax ), who are expanding operating hours by a minimum of 25 hours, could be eligible for $25,000, per site. oExpanded hours must be outside of normal or existing clinic hours oExpanded hours must be completed within 120 days of the application's approval and are not retroactive. 18KidsVaxGrant 2.0 Eligibility $10K Enrollment Grant: Enrolled in myCAvax from December 17, 2021, through October 15, 2022 Placed at least one completed order of COVID -19 vaccines for the infant and toddler population (6 months -5 years population) Expend grant funds on allowable expenses $25K Expansion Grant: Expanded hours by a total of 25 hours (a one -time, temporary expansion) and must be outside of normal or existing clinic hours oExpanded hours must be completed within 120 days of the application's approval and are not retroactive. Placed at least one completed order of COVID -19 vaccines for the infant and toddler population (6 months -5 years population) Expend grant funds on allowable expenseVaccine Administration Data Elizabeth Reosti , CDPH 19Vaccine Administration Summary as of August 15, 2022 2079,254,997 Total Doses Administered: Public DashboardTrends in Vaccine Administration as of August 15, 2022 21New eligibility among under 5 First boosters among 5 -11-year-olds Second boosters among 50+ year -olds FDA Coronavirus Update_June 17, 2022New Eligibility Groups Driving DemandInfant/Toddler Vaccination Trends as of August 15, 2022 22Disparities in vaccination coverage rates by Vaccine Equity Metric Quartile after first seven weeks of eligibility Children living in the Most Healthy Places are >7 times more likely to have initiated vaccination than children living in the Least Healthy Places14.1% ptsInfant/Toddler Vaccination Trends as of August 15 , 2022 23Slower rollout over the first 57 days of eligibility for youngest eligibility group Census Household Pulse Survey: California June 29 -July 11 24 Week 47 Household Pulse Survey: June 29 -July 11Among those reporting, the Child in household does not have at least one dose of a COVID -19 Vaccine Parents of Black, Asian, and Hispanic children are more likely to say they definitely or probably WILL get their children a vaccine than parents of White children. (-18% pts) 71% population 50+ years with 1+ booster |62-80% range by race and ethnicity System Notes Vaccination data for children under 5 years of age added to all dashboards Coverage rate s using total population denominator 4thdoses included in overall dose count, but not currently displayed in immunization statusData Summary Data Summary as of August 15, 2022 26Monkeypox Updates Tarek Salih, M.D. MPH (CDPH) 27Available Vaccines for Monkeypox JYNNEOS Given as two dose series 28 -days apart Part of Strategic National Stockpile (SNS) Estimates to procure 5.5 million doses by mid -2023 Produced by single company (Bavarian Nordic -Denmark) Side effects of injection site reactions (pain/redness/swelling) common ACAM2000 Single dose vaccine given through bifurcated "needling" technique Stockpiled as defense against bioterrorism attack At least 100 million doses, potentially more Notable side effect profile including risk for auto -inoculation Not currently distributed by CDPH 28 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Vaccine Eligibility Post -Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP) for known close contacts of monkeypox cases who are identified by public health via case investigation, contact tracing, and risk exposure assessments. Post -Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP)++ for individuals with certain risk factors who are more likely to have been recently exposed to monkeypox even if they have not had documented exposure to someone with confirmed monkeypox. Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis ( PrEP ) for individuals at occupational risk ofmonkeypox according to Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) guidance , including laboratory workers who perform monkeypox testing, and clinical and public health workers who collect monkeypox specimens. Also, consideration of PrEP for high -risk populations. 29 CDC Vaccination StrategiesJYNNEOS EUA: Intradermal Administration for >18 8/9/22 ,FDA issued authorization (EUA) allowing an alternative regimen: One-fifth (0.1mL) dose given weeks , 28days ,apart . For individuals >18 years old at high risk of MPX infection . Data reviewed included clinical study comparing subcutaneous andintradermal (one -fifth dose )administration Similar immune response in both groups. Intradermal administration resulted in 100% of recipients with redness, firmness, itchiness or swelling at the injection site, but these side effects were manageable. 30 Monkeypox Update: FDA Authorizes Emergency Use of JYNNEOS for <18 years old 8/9/22, FDA EUA also allows for use of the vaccine in individuals younger than 18 years of age determined to be at high risk of MPX infection For <18 years old, JYNNEOS is administered bysubcutaneous injection. If a pediatric high -risk contact case is identified for whom PEP JYNNEOS is being considered , please contact local health department. 31 Monkeypox Update: FDA Authorizes Emergency Use of JYNNEOS VaccineAlternative and Standard Vaccine Regimens 32 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Alternative and Standard Vaccine Regimens 33 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Alternative and Standard Vaccine Regimens 34 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Intradermal Administration 35 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000 Intradermal Administration 36 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Intradermal Administration 37 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Intradermal Administration 38 Interim Clinical Considerations for use of JYNNEOS and ACAM2000Storage & Handling Kate McHugh, CDPH 39Bivalent Booster Storage and Handling CDPH does not have any specifics yet Bivalent Boosters should Have a new National Drug Code (NDC) Have the same storage and handling requirements as the products currently authorized With more types of vaccines in inventory, it is important to ensure you are clearly organizing and labeling items in your refrigerator Always triple -check that you are administering the correct vaccine before you administer it! 40 Vaccine Administration ChecklistNovavax Expiry CDPH heard from a few providers that their Novavax expiration dates changed after receipt. Double check and make sure you have the most up -to-date expiration dates for your Novavax using the link found here: https://us.novavaxcovidvaccine.com/hcp 41COVID -19 Provider Operations Manual (POM) 42 Receiving Novavax Shipments Product is authorized under EUA as a two -dose primary series for individuals 18 years and older. DO NOT DILUTE. Vaccine ships like other routine refrigerated vaccines at temperatures between 2 °to 8°C. Vaccine ships in a small, single -use shipper; dispose of shipper. Store unpunctured multi -dose vials in a refrigerator between 2 °to 8°C (36 °to 46 °F) until expiration. DO NOT FREEZE. Apply storage and handling labels to cartons or plastic bag holding vials to prevent administration errors. Novavax Vaccine Fact Sheet & Receiving Guidance COVID -19 Provider Operations Manual (POM) 43 Managing Expiration & Beyond -Use Dates Expiration dates may not be printed on the vial and may change as more stability data become available. All manufacturers provide online expiry checkers to assist! Manufacturer -shortened expiration dates may apply if storing unpunctured vials under conditions other than coldest recommended temperatures. Apply CDC's vaccine -specific BUD tracking labels so vaccines aren't used past these reduced limits. After Puncture: Label vial with puncture date/time so vaccine is not used after this time limit. Always discard vaccine after the earlier of the expiration or beyond -usedate. Managing Expiration & Beyond -Use Dates Storage and Handling Quickinar_Archived 8.18.22 Vaccine Management Eric Norton, My Turn, and Daniel Conway, myCAvax 44What's Next in My Turn? -Release 29.1 45My Turn Public My Turn Clinic Release Highlights Eligible patients who are 18 years and older can schedule Monkeypox vaccine appointments for both doses with a gap of 4 weeks between each dose. Patients can view and use the new Eligibility Interactive Chart (both Desktop and Mobile versions available) in English and 13 other languages to identify their eligibility for the available COVID vaccines.Release Highlights Vaccine Administrators can identify an existing patient's records when creating a walk -in appointment which can reduce the chances of duplicate records. Walk -in appointment flow for COVID, Flu, and Monkeypox display new values for the Gender field Clinic Managers can create Monkeypox JYNNEOS (18+) vaccine supply, vaccine inventory, edit patient's IIS Monkeypox appointment records, filter, single edit, and cancel Monkeypox JYNNEOS (18+) AppointmentsNew updates for My Turn Public and Clinic launched on August 15th. 46 Monkeypox Functionality: Clinic Setup 1 2 3 1.You can make multiple selections from the Vaccine Type section. 2.For clinics only offering the Monkeypox vaccine, only first dose, second dose, and all doses are applicable. 3.JYNNEOS is the only available Monkeypox vaccine brand.47 Monkeypox Functionality: Add a Walk -In 1.My Turn will search for existing patients based on the first name, last name, and date of birth. 2.The Gender field has been relabeled as Sex Assigned at Birth a.There are two new, Monkeypox - specific fields for Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity. 3.Appointments are automatically scheduled four weeks apart. 4.There is an additional questions section for patients receiving the Monkeypox vaccine. 1 2 2a 3 448 Monkeypox Functionality: Vaccine Administration 1 21.After screening, there is a question regarding additional risk groups for patients receiving the Monkeypox vaccine. 2.Intradermal injection of the Monkeypox vaccine is supported on My Turn.49Clinics can capture Novavax vaccination data offline using a bulk upload CSV file which is available on EZIZ under the My Turn Offline Resources section. You can use this file to easily upload appointments once Novavax becomes available in My Turn. You may contact the My Turn Help Desk by calling 833 -502-1245, Option 4, or emailing MyTurn.Clinic.HD@accenture.com for any additional questions.My Turn Novavax Update Clinic Managers and Vaccine Administrators *50 appointments per CSV50myCAvax Bivalent Booster Ordering LHDs/MCEs/Providers We anticipate opening up myCAvax for pre-orders on Monday, August 22nd. Deliveries would occur after Labor Day, pending all FDA and ACIP approvals. Watch out for a communication on Monday. 51 The latest version of the myCAvax Interactive Guide has been published to the Knowledge Center . The document now includes a quick navigation guide, an introduction to the Provider Operations Manual, and information on the Vaccine Marketplace and courier services. Explore the guide to learn more! View the Updated myCAvax Interactive Guide in the Knowledge Center 52APPENDIXmyCAvax -Known Issues -Updated 8/12 53 Known Issues Unable to see Excursion Events others create? We are working to correct an issue where you are only able to see Excursion Events that you create yourself New Links on CDC Product Training Page Novavax Vaccine Preparation & Administration Storage & Handling Workaround/Next Steps Fix: 8/16/2022 Estimated implementation: 8/16/2022 Slide Icon Key 54Icon Meaning This is to label slides that are referencing upcoming or existing functionality and how to use it in the system. Clear It. Trust and Safety Team Our shared mission is to reduce COVID -19 vaccine hesitancy and increase vaccination across the State of California. CTAContactHow You Can Help You are critical in our effort to provide Californians accurate and timely information around COVID -19 vaccination.Monitor What You See and Hear Monitor online media and what you hear in your local communities for potential rumors and inaccurate information. If found, report it torumors@cdph.ca.gov If you see or hear of any vaccine -related rumors within the communities you serve, share them with our Trust and Safety team via the CDPH Rumors Inbox. 67Provider Webinar Q&A 68 During today's session, please use the Q&A panel to ask your questions so CDPH subject matter experts can respond directly .
